title: Bierley, West Yorkshire
text:
Bierley is a former township in the <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a> whose name now mainly refers to a neighbourhood in the <a href="Tong%20%28ward%29">Tong ward</a> of the <a href="City%20of%20Bradford">City of Bradford</a>, <a href="West%20Yorkshire">West Yorkshire</a>, <a href="England">England</a>.
Geography.
Bierley housing estate is situated about southeast of the centre of Bradford, south of the <a href="A650%20road">A650 road</a> and the <a href="A6036%20road">A6036 road</a>. Neighbouring places are in clockwise order: <a href="Oakenshaw%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Oakenshaw</a> in the south, <a href="Low%20Moor%2C%20Bradford">Low Moor</a>, <a href="Odsal">Odsal</a>, Bankfoot, <a href="West%20Bowling">West Bowling</a>, <a href="East%20Bowling">East Bowling</a>, <a href="Dudley%20Hill">Dudley Hill</a>, <a href="Holme%20Wood">Holme Wood</a>, Westgate Hill and <a href="Tong%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Tong</a> Village in the City of Bradford and <a href="East%20Bierley">East Bierley</a> in <a href="Kirklees">Kirklees</a> in the southeast.
History.
In 1872 Bierley was recorded as a township that included the village of Wibsey, the hamlets of Bierley Lane, Carr Lane, Hilltop, Odsal Moor, Woodhouse Hill and Folly Hall, and the districts of Low Moor (where the <a href="Leeds%2C%20Bradford%20and%20Halifax%20Junction%20Railway">Leeds, Bradford and Halifax Junction Railway</a> had a <a href="Low%20Moor%20railway%20station">station</a>) and Slack. Its population was about 9,500 persons in 1841 and 12,500 in 1861. The township was also known as "North Bierley", to distinguish it from similarly named places. This is remembered in the name of North Bierley cemetery, opened in 1902 and situated between Low Moor and Buttershaw.
The former township has been split up following administrative reorganisation. The modern housing estate of Bierley, Bierley Hall Wood, and the hamlets of Bierley Lane and Hilltop now belong to Tong ward. Low Moor and Carr Lane are part of Wyke ward, while Wibsey, Slack and Folly Hall are in <a href="Wibsey">Wibsey</a> ward.
